japanese: 彼の小説は長い間たいへん人気があった。
english: His novel had a great vogue for a long time.

japanese: 彼の小説は若者に愛読されている。
english: His novels are popular among young people.

japanese: 彼の小説は私には理解できない。
english: His novel is beyond my comprehension.

japanese: 彼の小説は私には難しすぎる。
english: His novels are too deep for me.

japanese: 彼の小説は英語に翻訳されているので、アメリカで広く読まれている。
english: His novels, having been translated into English, are widely read in America.

japanese: 彼の小説は英語とフランス語でも出ています。
english: His novels also appear in English and French.

japanese: 彼の小説はよく売れた。
english: His novel sold well.

japanese: 彼の小説はフランス語でもでています。
english: His novels also appear in French.

japanese: 彼の小説は１つも読んでいない。
english: I haven't read any of his novels.

japanese: 彼の小説の両方とも読んだわけではない。
english: I haven't read both of his novels.

japanese: 彼の小説の中でこれが一番好きだ。
english: Among his novels, I like this best.

japanese: 彼の小説の大部分はとても退屈だ。
english: His novels are, for the most part, very boring.

japanese: 彼の商売は大損失に終わった。
english: His business resulted in heavy losses.

japanese: 彼の商売は何ですか。
english: What is his business?

japanese: 彼の商売はますます悪くなった。
english: His business has gone from bad to worse.

japanese: 彼の商売はうまくいっている。
english: His business is doing well.

japanese: 彼の召使いでさえも彼を軽蔑した。
english: His very servants despised him.

japanese: 彼の傷口に彼女はハンカチをあてがった。
english: She applied her handkerchief to his wound.

japanese: 彼の助力を当てにしています。
english: We look to him for help.

japanese: 彼の助手は彼の靴を磨いた。
english: His assistant polished his shoes.

japanese: 彼の助手がその書類の山を何度も繰り返し調べた。
english: His assistant examined the pile of papers over and over again.

japanese: 彼の助言は命令も同然だ。
english: His advice amounts to an order.

japanese: 彼の助言は非常に役に立った。
english: His advice was very helpful.

japanese: 彼の助言のおかげで、私たちは思ったより早く終えられた。
english: Thanks to his advice, we could finish it earlier than we had expected.

japanese: 彼の助言に注意しなさい。
english: Pay attention to his advice.

japanese: 彼の助言など役に立たない。
english: His advice is of no use.

japanese: 彼の助けを頼りにすることはできないよ。
english: You can't count on his help.

japanese: 彼の助けを求めさえすればよい。
english: You have only to ask for his help.

japanese: 彼の助けは当てにならない。
english: You can't rely on his help.

japanese: 彼の助けのおかげで私は仕事を終わらせることができた。
english: His help enabled me to finish the work.

japanese: 彼の助けが必要なんだ。
english: I need his help.

japanese: 彼の助けがなければ私は死んでいた。
english: If I hadn't had his help, I would be dead.

japanese: 彼の助けがなければ、私は失敗するかもしれない。
english: But for his help, I might fail.

japanese: 彼の助けがなければ、あなたの成功は考えられないだろう。
english: But for his help, your success would be impossible.

japanese: 彼の助けがなかったら私は失敗しただろう。
english: I would have failed but for his help.

japanese: 彼の助けがなかったら君は失敗していただろう。
english: You would have failed but for his help.

japanese: 彼の助けがなかったら、私は失敗したろう。
english: Had it not been for his help, I should have failed.

japanese: 彼の書斎は公園に面している。
english: His study gives on the park.

japanese: 彼の書斎には本がたくさんある。
english: There are plenty of books in his study.

japanese: 彼の書斎には少なくとも１０００冊の本がある。
english: He has not less than 1,000 books in his study.

japanese: 彼の書斎には何百冊という本が有る。
english: There are hundreds of books in his study.

japanese: 彼の書いていることはこういう意味だ。
english: What he writes comes to this.

japanese: 彼の書く英語は正確だ。
english: He writes correct English.

japanese: 彼の所持品は全部あの箱に入っている。
english: All his possessions are contained in that box.

japanese: 彼の庶民的な経歴は前任者のそれと似ている。
english: His humble background parallels that of his predecessor.

japanese: 彼の所は大家族だ。
english: His family is large.

japanese: 彼の所に行くのは足が重い。
english: I'm reluctant to visit him.

japanese: 彼の所にせっせと足を運んだ。
english: I went to his place straight away.

japanese: 彼の初期の詩は少年時代の体験や記憶をおびただしく利用している。
english: His early poetry draws heavily on his experience and memories of childhood.

japanese: 彼の準備が間に合わないので私たちは彼を置いて出かけた。
english: We went without him, as he wasn't ready.

japanese: 彼の出費は収入をはるかに上回っている。
english: His expenses exceed his income by far.

japanese: 彼の出世は怒濤の勢いだ。
english: His career is progressing in leaps and bounds.

japanese: 彼の出身はアイルランドである。
english: He is an Irishman by origin.

japanese: 彼の叔母は猫を３匹飼っている。
english: His aunt has three cats.

japanese: 彼の叔父は金持ちらしかった。
english: His uncle appeared rich.

japanese: 彼の叔父は家を十軒も持っている。
english: His uncle owns no fewer than ten houses.

japanese: 彼の重さでロープがぴんと張った。
english: His weight strained the rope.

japanese: 彼の従姉妹は、名前は忘れたが、看護婦だった。
english: His cousin, whose name I forget, was a nurse.

japanese: 彼の住所を知らなかったので、彼女は彼に手紙を書かなかった。
english: Not knowing his address, she didn't write to him.

japanese: 彼の住所を知っていればいいのだが。
english: If only I knew his address.

japanese: 彼の住所を書き留めなさい。
english: Put his address down.

japanese: 彼の住所をはっきりしらない。
english: I don't know his address for certain.

japanese: 彼の住所が正しいかどうかを調べるために彼に照会した。
english: I checked with him to see if his address was right.

japanese: 彼の週給は２０ドルです。
english: His weekly wages are $20.

japanese: 彼の舟は２時間、海に出ている。
english: His boat has been at sea for two hours.

japanese: 彼の周りのものは全て粉々に吹き飛ばされたが、彼はすり傷１つ負わずに逃げた。
english: Everything around him was blown to pieces, yet he escaped without a scratch.

japanese: 彼の周りには人がたかり始めた。
english: A crowd was gathering around him.

japanese: 彼の収入は彼の妻の収入より多い。
english: His income is larger than that of his wife.

japanese: 彼の収入は退職後半減した。
english: His income was diminished by half after retirement.

japanese: 彼の収入は相当なものだ。
english: He has a considerable income.

japanese: 彼の収入は少なすぎて家族を養うことはできない。
english: His income is too small to support his family.

japanese: 彼の収入は社会的地位とつりあっていない。
english: His income bears no proportion to his social standing.

japanese: 彼の収入は私の３倍だ。
english: His income is three times larger than mine.

japanese: 彼の収入の大部分は家賃で消える。
english: The majority of his income goes to pay his rent.

japanese: 彼の収入のことを詳しく話さない。
english: He's coy about his income.

japanese: 彼の収入ではやりくりが難しいとわかったので、彼女は働きだした。
english: Finding it hard to make ends meet on his income, she started to work.

japanese: 彼の収入ではそのような高価な食事をする余裕はありません。
english: With his income, he cannot afford the costly dinners.

japanese: 彼の寿命は終わろうとしている。
english: His sands are running out.

japanese: 彼の受けたひどい被害に彼女は同情した。
english: His terrible suffering aroused her pity.

japanese: 彼の首相辞任は大きな驚きであった。
english: His resignation as Prime Minister came as a surprise.

japanese: 彼の趣味は日曜日に釣りに出かけることです。
english: His hobby is going fishing on Sundays.

japanese: 彼の趣味は珍しいチョウの収集だ。
english: His hobby is collecting strange butterflies.

japanese: 彼の趣味は古い切手を集めることです。
english: His hobby is collecting old stamps.

japanese: 彼の趣味は絵を描くことです。
english: His hobby is painting pictures.

japanese: 彼の趣味は花の絵を描くことです。
english: His hobby is painting pictures of flowers.

japanese: 彼の趣味はギターを弾いて歌う事だ。
english: His hobbies are playing the guitar and singing.

japanese: 彼の趣味は、切手を集めることである。
english: His hobby is collecting stamps.

japanese: 彼の手法は全く驚くべきものだった。
english: His technique was absolutely amazing.

japanese: 彼の手助けのおかげで私はその仕事を終えることができた。
english: His help enabled me to finish the work.

japanese: 彼の手助けのおかげで、私は宿題を終わった。
english: Thanks to his help, I finished my homework.

japanese: 彼の手紙は非常に乱雑だから、私はまったく意味をとることができなかった。
english: His letter was so confused that I could hardly make any sense of it at all.

japanese: 彼の手紙は彼女を怒らせた。
english: His letter made her angry.

japanese: 彼の手紙は意味をなさない。
english: His letter doesn't make any sense.

japanese: 彼の手紙はその事件にそれとなくふれている。
english: His letter alludes to the event.

japanese: 彼の手紙の返事を出さなければいけません、それも今すぐ。
english: You must answer his letter, and that at once.

japanese: 彼の手紙に返信を出すべきだったのに。
english: You should have replied to his letter.

japanese: 彼の手紙に返事を出すことを忘れるな。
english: Remember to answer his letter.

japanese: 彼の手紙に返事を出さなくちゃいけないかしら。
english: Should I reply to his letter?

japanese: 彼の手紙に返事をださなきゃ。
english: I have to answer his letter.

japanese: 彼の手紙には来週の日曜日に着くと書いてありました。
english: His letter says he'll arrive next Sunday.

japanese: 彼の手紙には写真が一枚同封されていた。
english: His letter enclosed a picture.

japanese: 彼の手紙にはなんて書いてあるの。
english: What does he say in his letter?

japanese: 彼の手紙で彼女は虚栄心を傷つけられた。
english: His letter hurt Jane's vanity.

japanese: 彼の手紙がとても情熱的だったので彼女は感動して涙がでできた。
english: So passionate was his letter that she was moved to tears.

japanese: 彼の手紙がこなかったので彼女はがっかりした。
english: To her disappointment, his letter didn't come.

japanese: 彼の手は泥だらけだった。
english: His hands were covered with mud.

japanese: 彼の手はざらざらしている。
english: His hands feel rough.

japanese: 彼の手は寒さで青白くなっていた。
english: His hands were blue because of the cold.

japanese: 彼の手のひらに硬貨を置く。
english: Place a coin in the palm of his hand.

japanese: 彼の取れるのはよくて千票でしょう。
english: At best he'll get 1,000 votes.

japanese: 彼の主張はベンソンが『Ｅｎｔｒｅｐｒｅｎｅｕｒｓ』で主張していることと事実上同じである。
english: His claim is really the same as the one Benson proposed in Entrepreneurs.

japanese: 彼の主張は、生まれの順番と性格の間には密接な関連があるということだ。
english: His claim is that there is a close relation between birth order and personality.

japanese: 彼の主張は、女性は酒もタバコもやってはいけないという事だ。
english: His argument is that women should not smoke or drink.

japanese: 彼の主張には根拠がないことに注意することが重要である。
english: It is important to note that his assertion is groundless.

japanese: 彼の主治医達は、彼が以前と同じようにものを見、聞き、味わうことはできるだろうと彼に告げた。
english: His doctors told him that he would see, hear, and taste as before.

japanese: 彼の主治医は全速力でやって来た。
english: His doctor came with all speed.

japanese: 彼の主な興味は史学にある。
english: His main interest is in history.

japanese: 彼の弱点が彼の長所を帳消しにしている。
english: His weakness cancels out his virtues.

japanese: 彼の弱みに付け込むのはやめなさい。
english: Stop taking advantage of his weakness.

japanese: 彼の若さを考慮に入れるべきだ。
english: We should take his youth into account.

japanese: 彼の若さを考慮して、警察は彼を告発しないことに決めた。
english: In light of his youth the police have decided not to charge him.

japanese: 彼の借金は相当な額になっている。
english: His debts amount to a considerable sum.

japanese: 彼の借金は総計２０００ドルにのぼる。
english: His debts amount to $2,000.

japanese: 彼の借金は合計十万円になる。
english: His debts amount to 100,000 yen.

japanese: 彼の借金は合計１０００ドル以上になる。
english: His debts amount to over $1000.

japanese: 彼の借金は五百万円に達した。
english: His debts amounted to five million yen.

japanese: 彼の借金はかなりの額に達している。
english: His debts amount to a considerable sum.

japanese: 彼の借金はかなりの額にのぼった。
english: His debt amounted to a considerable sum.

japanese: 彼の借金は２００万ドルに達している。
english: His debts amount to two million dollars.

japanese: 彼の借金は１千ドルに達した。
english: His debts amounted to a thousand dollars.

japanese: 彼の借金は１００ドルに達した。
english: His debt came to 100 dollars.

japanese: 彼の借金の合計は１０００ドル以上になる。
english: His debts amount to over $1000.

japanese: 私たちは彼の邪魔をした。
english: We disturbed him.

japanese: 彼の車は大変カッコイイ。
english: His car is really cool.

japanese: 彼の車は青で、彼女のは赤だった。
english: His car was blue; hers was red.

japanese: 彼の車は新車同然に見える。
english: His car looks as good as new.

japanese: 彼の車は小さくてほとんど場所を取らない。
english: His car is small and takes up little room.

japanese: 彼の車は修理が終わったばかりです。
english: His car has just been repaired.

japanese: 彼の車は私のと似ている。
english: His car is similar to mine.

japanese: 彼の車は湖の中に落ちた。
english: His car fell into the lake.

japanese: 彼の車は最新式だ。
english: His car is a new model.

japanese: 彼の車は会社への途上で、故障した。
english: His car broke down on the way to work.

japanese: 彼の車はフォード製です。
english: His car is a Ford.

japanese: 彼の車はひどく壊れた。
english: His car was seriously damaged.

japanese: 彼の車はトンネルの壁をかすめて通った。
english: His car shaved the wall of the tunnel.

japanese: 彼の車はその鉄の門にぶち当たった。
english: His car ran into the Iron Gate.

japanese: 彼の車はすぐに見えなくなった。
english: His car soon went out of sight.

japanese: 彼の車は１４マイルしか走れなかった。
english: His car got no more than fourteen miles.

japanese: 彼の車はかぎが掛けられたままになっていた。
english: His car remained locked.

japanese: 彼の車は、川に落ちる前に数回ひっくりかえった。
english: His car turned over several times before falling into the river.

japanese: 彼の車は、実際はがらくた同然だ。
english: His car is in fact worn out.

japanese: 彼の車にはホイールがありません。
english: His car has no wheels.

japanese: 彼の車が我々に追いつきつつある。
english: His car is gaining on us.

japanese: 彼の写真が新聞に載っていた。
english: His picture was in the newspaper.

japanese: 彼の煮え切らない態度にいらいらした。
english: I was vexed at his irresolute attitude.

japanese: 彼の芝居は当たった。
english: His play was a hit.

japanese: 彼の芝居は大成功に終わった。
english: His play ended in large success.

japanese: 彼の実験結果は私のと一致した。
english: The result of his experiment corresponded with mine.

japanese: 彼の実験は壁にぶつかった。
english: His experiments came to a standstill.

japanese: 彼の実験は細部において多くの欠陥があった。
english: His experiment had many faults in its details.

japanese: 彼の質問に対して、私は英語で精一杯の答えをした。
english: I gave him the best answer in English to his question that I could.

japanese: 彼の嫉妬が頭をもたげてきた。
english: His jealousy began to raise its head again.

japanese: 彼の質問にひどく面食らってしまった。
english: I was very confused by his questions.

japanese: 彼の失敗をどう説明しますか。
english: How do you account for his failure?

japanese: 彼の失敗は無能によるものかそれとも不運によるものか。
english: Is his failure ascribable to incompetence or to bad luck?

japanese: 彼の失敗は無知のせいである。
english: His failure is due to his ignorance.

japanese: 彼の失敗は不注意によるものだ。
english: His failure resulted from his carelessness.

japanese: 彼の失敗は大部分不注意のせいだった。
english: His failure was mainly due to carelessness.

japanese: 彼の失敗は辞職という結果になった。
english: His failure led to his resignation.

japanese: 彼の失敗は私には何の関係もない。
english: His failure has nothing to do with me.

japanese: 彼の失敗は私にはなんのかかわりもない。
english: His failure has nothing to do with me.

japanese: 彼の失敗は私にとって良い教訓になりました。
english: His failure taught me a good lesson.

japanese: 彼の失敗は私が絶対に予想しなかったことである。
english: His failure was the last thing that I expected.

japanese: 彼の失敗は考えられない。
english: His failure is out of the question.

japanese: 彼の失敗は、ある意味では私たちの失敗でもある。
english: His failure is, in a manner, our failure too.

japanese: 彼の失敗の直接の原因は勉強不足だった。
english: The immediate cause of his failure was lack of study.

japanese: 彼の失敗の第一の要因は怠惰である事だ。
english: The primary cause of his failure is laziness.

japanese: 彼の失敗の原因を勤勉さがなかったせいにすべきではない。
english: His failure is not to be ascribed to want of diligence.

japanese: 彼の失敗には、２、３の理由があるように思われる。
english: There seem to be several reasons for his failure.

japanese: 彼の辞職で官僚の席に空きができた。
english: His resignation left a vacancy in the cabinet.

japanese: 彼の自慢話はまったく聞き飽きた。
english: I am sick to death of his boasts.

japanese: 彼の自転車は青い。
english: His bicycle is blue.

japanese: 彼の自転車はこの自転車とは違う。
english: His bicycle is different from this one.

japanese: 彼の自叙伝が今日発売され、午前中に完売した。
english: His autobiography was released today and was sold out by noon.

japanese: 彼の自殺は失恋の結果であった。
english: His suicide came as a result of his disappointment in love.

japanese: 彼の耳の病気は音を聞くことをとても困難にした。
english: His ear trouble made hearing very difficult.

japanese: 彼の治世の次の十年間の政治的状況は、控え目に言っても極度に不安定であった。
english: The political situation was, to say the least, extremely unstable during the next ten years of his reign.

japanese: 彼の次の制作は非常に意欲的なミュージカルだった。
english: His next production was a very ambitious musical.

japanese: 彼の時を得た救助がなかったら、私は溺れていただろう。
english: But for his timely rescue, I would have drowned.

japanese: 彼の時ならぬ発言は秘密をもらしたばかりではなく、平和運動の計画をも、くつがえしてしまった。
english: His untimely statement has not only let the cat out of the bag but also upset the apple cart for the peace move.

japanese: 彼の持っている本の中には英語の小説もある。
english: Some of the books that he has are English novels.

japanese: 彼の字を読むことは不可能だ。
english: His writing is impossible to read.

japanese: 彼の事務所は町の中心部に位置している。
english: His office is located in the center of the town.

japanese: 彼の事務所は資金不足で閉鎖されることになっている。
english: His office is going to be shut down for want of money.

japanese: 彼の事務所は銀行の向こうの左側にあります。
english: His office is past the bank on your left.

japanese: 彼の事務所は駅のすぐ近くで便利だ。
english: His office is convenient to the station.

japanese: 彼の事務所は８階にあります。
english: His office is on the eighth floor.

japanese: 彼の事務所の家具はなかなか近代的だ。
english: The furniture in his office is very modern.

japanese: 彼の事務所ならちょっと先です。
english: His office is right up there.

japanese: 彼の事業を息子に譲った。
english: He turned over the business to his son.

japanese: 彼の事業もやっと萌芽の兆しを見せた。
english: His business has begun to thrive at last.

japanese: 彼の事業は部分的な成功をおさめたにすぎなかった。
english: His business was only a partial success.

japanese: 彼の事業は破滅しかかっているとの噂だ。
english: I hear his business is on the verge of ruin.

japanese: 彼の事業は破産しそうだといううわさだ。
english: I hear his business is on the verge of going bankrupt.

japanese: 彼の事業はどんどん伸びている。
english: His business is growing rapidly.

japanese: 彼の事業の成功を鼻にかけるのを私は好みません。
english: I don't like his boasting of his success in business.

japanese: 彼の事を公平に言えば、彼は利己的な男ではないよ。
english: To do him justice, he is not a selfish man.

japanese: 彼の事は名前しか知らない。
english: I know him only by name.

japanese: 彼の事は忘れなさい。
english: Forget him.

japanese: 彼の歯は煙草の吸いすぎで黄色くなっている。
english: His teeth are yellow from smoking too much.

japanese: 彼の資金はいつなくなると思いますか。
english: When do you think his funds will run out?

japanese: 彼の試験を採点する前に、彼が病気だったことを考慮に入れなくてはならない。
english: We must take his illness into consideration before marking his exam.

japanese: 彼の詩は理解するのが難しい。
english: His poems are difficult to understand.

japanese: 彼の詩は日本語に翻訳できない。
english: His poetry does not translate into Japanese.

japanese: 彼の詩は次のようにかかれている。
english: His poem reads as follows.

japanese: 彼の視力は衰えつつある。
english: His eyesight is failing.

japanese: 彼の私事に触れることはできない。
english: We cannot touch on his private affairs.

japanese: 彼の私を見る目つきがとても気にさわった。
english: The way he looked at me irritated me very much.

japanese: 彼の私に対する情熱はさめない。
english: His passion for me doesn't cool.

japanese: 彼の死亡告知が新聞に出た。
english: An announcement of his death appeared in the newspapers.

japanese: 彼の死後１０年が過ぎ去った。
english: Ten years have gone by since his death.

japanese: 彼の死後、私の人生は１８０度変わった。
english: After he died, my life was turned upside down.

japanese: 彼の死因はガンだった。
english: He died of cancer.

japanese: 彼の死因はいまだに謎である。
english: The cause of his death still remains a mystery.

japanese: 彼の死を聞かされて深く心を痛めた。
english: I was deeply affected when I heard of his death.

japanese: 彼の死を嘆き悲しんだ。
english: I felt deep sorrow at his death.

japanese: 彼の死を考えると私は悲しくなる。
english: It makes me sad to think of his death.

japanese: 彼の死をめぐってあるうわさが広まっている。
english: A rumor is abroad about his death.

japanese: 彼の死は無駄ではなかった。
english: He didn't die in vain.

japanese: 彼の死は彼らの生活に空しさをもたらした。
english: His death has left a vacuum in their lives.

japanese: 彼の死は大損失だ。
english: His death is a great loss.

japanese: 彼の死は惜しんでも余りあるものだ。
english: We cannot grieve over his death too deeply.

japanese: 彼の死は数週間発表されなかった。
english: News of his death wasn't published for several weeks.

japanese: 彼の死は世界中に放送された。
english: His death was broadcast all over the world.

japanese: 彼の死は崇高な自己犠牲だった。
english: His death was a sublime self-sacrifice.

japanese: 彼の死は事故だとする君の推定は間違っているようだ。
english: Your assumption that his death was an accident seems to be wrong.

japanese: 彼の死は私たちみんなを驚かせた。
english: His death surprised us all.

japanese: 彼の死は思いがけない出来事だった。
english: His death was a bolt from the blue.

japanese: 彼の死は妻にとってあまりにもショックだった。
english: His death was great shock to his wife.

japanese: 彼の死は国家的な損失だと思います。
english: I think his death is a national loss.

japanese: 彼の死は皆を悲しませた。
english: His death made all feel sorry.

japanese: 彼の死は我が社にとって大きな痛手であった。
english: His death was a great loss to our firm.

japanese: 彼の死はわが国にとって一大損失であった。
english: His death was a great loss to our country.

japanese: 彼の死の知らせはまさに青天の霹靂だった。
english: The news of his death came like a bolt from out of the blue.

japanese: 彼の死の原因は無謀運転だった。
english: His death was owing to his reckless driving.

japanese: 彼の死の原因は自動車事故だった。
english: The cause of his death was a car accident.

japanese: 彼の死でその探索は中止された。
english: His death brought the expedition to an end.

japanese: 彼の死が公表された。
english: His death was made known to the public.

japanese: 彼の支出は収入をはるかに上回っている。
english: His expenses exceed his income by far.

japanese: 彼の助け無しには、やっていけない。
english: I cannot manage without his support.

japanese: 彼の指導の下で商売は繁盛した。
english: The business prospered beneath his guiding hand.

japanese: 彼の指摘はいつもたいへん要領を得ている。
english: His suggestions are always very much to the point.

japanese: 彼の指示は明白だった。
english: He was explicit in his instruction.

japanese: 彼の指はすばやく鍵盤の上を走った。
english: His fingers ran swiftly over the keys.

japanese: 彼の指に痛みが走った。
english: Pain shot through his finger.

japanese: 彼の思慮の無さには驚いた。
english: He was amazed at his foolishness.

japanese: 彼の思想は彼の体験に基づいている。
english: His ideas are based on his experience.

japanese: 彼の思想は進歩的過ぎて普通の人達には受け入れられなかった。
english: His ideas were too far advanced to be accepted by ordinary people.

japanese: 彼の思想は進歩的だ。
english: His thought is progressive.

japanese: 彼の思想は時勢と相いれなかった。
english: His ideas were out of harmony with the times.

japanese: 彼の思想は私の心にはっきり銘記された。
english: His idea was imprinted on my mind.

japanese: 彼の思想はあまりに過激で、たいていの人には受け入れられない。
english: His ideas are too radical to be acceptable to most people.

japanese: 彼の思うままにならないのが言語なのだ。
english: What he can't manage at will is language.

japanese: 彼の思いつきは一文にもなったことがない。
english: His ideas never fetched him a nickel.

japanese: 彼の子供達はみんな誕生日にプレゼントをほしがる。
english: All his children want presents on their birthdays.

japanese: 彼の子供は行儀がよい。
english: His child behaves well.

japanese: 彼の子供の命が危ない。
english: His child's life is in danger.

japanese: 彼の子供の扱い方ときたらひどいものだ。
english: It's a crime the way he treats his children.

japanese: 彼の子供っぽい笑い方が素敵よね。
english: His childlike laugh is charming.

japanese: 彼の子供たちは成長した。
english: His children have grown up.

japanese: 彼の子供たちのめいめいが、自分自身の部屋を持っている。
english: Each of his children has his own room.

japanese: 彼の姿を見るなり私は恐怖で震えた。
english: Immediately I saw him, I trembled with fear.

japanese: 彼の姉は若く見える。
english: His sister looks young.

japanese: 彼の姉妹は二人とも美人です。
english: Both his sisters are beautiful.

japanese: 彼の姉は私の一番上の兄より年上である。
english: His elder sister is older than my eldest brother.

japanese: 彼の姉は医者になった。
english: His sister became a doctor.

japanese: 彼の姉はファッションのことを考えすぎる。
english: His sister makes too much of fashion.

japanese: 彼の姉さんはすごい美人だ。
english: His sister is a real beauty.

japanese: 彼の使った下品な言葉はとてもほかの人に伝えられない。
english: His dirty words can't bear repeating.

japanese: 彼の仕事を判断するには経験の無さを考慮すべきだ。
english: In judging his work, you should make allowances for his lack of experience.

japanese: 彼の仕事は与信管理です。
english: His job is to manage credit authorization.

japanese: 彼の仕事は綿密な検査に耐えられるものではない。
english: His work won't bear close examination.

japanese: 彼の仕事は貿易に関係している。
english: His work is concerned with international trade.

japanese: 彼の仕事は標準以下だ。
english: His work is below average.

japanese: 彼の仕事は販売の促進です。
english: His job is to promote sales.

japanese: 彼の仕事は水準に達した。
english: His work has come up to the standard.

japanese: 彼の仕事は申し分なかった。
english: His work was satisfactory.

japanese: 彼の仕事は申し分がない。
english: His work leaves nothing to be desired.

japanese: 彼の仕事は順調です。
english: He is doing well.

japanese: 彼の仕事は車を洗うことです。
english: His work is washing cars.

japanese: 彼の仕事は車なしではやっていけない。
english: In his business he cannot do without a car.

japanese: 彼の仕事は自慢するほどのものではない。
english: His work shows nothing to brag about.

japanese: 彼の仕事は時計を作ることです。
english: His work is making watches.

japanese: 彼の仕事は現場の労働者を監督することだった。
english: His work was supervising the labourers on the site.

japanese: 彼の仕事は完成している。
english: His work is now complete.

japanese: 彼の仕事は外国の買い手と交渉することだ。
english: His job is to negotiate with foreign buyers.

japanese: 彼の仕事は英語を教えることだ。
english: His job is to teach English.

japanese: 彼の仕事は印刷と関係がある。
english: His job has to do with printing.

japanese: 彼の仕事は井戸掘りからゴミの処理にまで及ぶ。
english: His tasks range from digging wells to getting rid of garbage.

japanese: 彼の仕事はまずまずの出来だが、とても優秀とは言えなかった。
english: His work was acceptable, but far from excellent.

japanese: 彼の仕事は観光バスの運転手です。
english: His job is driving a sight-seeing bus.

japanese: 彼の仕事はうまくいっている。
english: His business affairs are in good shape.

japanese: 彼の仕事の大半が都市部に集中している。
english: The bulk of his work is in the urban area.

japanese: 彼の仕事に将来性がない。
english: There is no future in his job.

japanese: 彼の仕事には注意不足が表れていた。
english: His work showed want of care.

japanese: 彼の仕事には間違いがない。
english: He is accurate in his work.

japanese: 彼の殺人の動機は何だ。
english: What's his motive for committing murder?

japanese: 彼の策略を見抜けた。
english: I saw through his little game.

japanese: 彼の昨日の発言は先週の発言と矛盾していた。
english: What he said yesterday was not in accord with what he said last week.

japanese: 彼の昨日の提案事項は検討中である。
english: The proposal he made yesterday is now under consideration.

japanese: 彼の昨日の欠席は風邪が原因だった。
english: His absence yesterday was due to his cold.

japanese: 彼の作文は断然一番よい。
english: His composition is by far the best of all.

japanese: 彼の作文は申し分ない。
english: His composition leaves nothing to be desired.

japanese: 彼の作文は誤りが少なくない。
english: His composition has not a few mistakes.

japanese: 彼の作文は完全に誤りがないというわけではない。
english: His composition is not perfectly free of mistakes.

japanese: 彼の作文に誤りがなかった。
english: His composition was free from mistakes.

japanese: 彼の作文には間違いがない。
english: His composition is free from mistakes.

japanese: 彼の作文にはまずほとんど誤りはない。
english: There are few, if any, mistakes in his composition.

japanese: 彼の作品を彼女のと比較してみよう。
english: Let's compare his work with hers.

japanese: 彼の作品を知っているといってもほんの少しです。
english: My acquaintance with his works is slight.

japanese: 彼の作品を審査するときには、彼の経験不足を考慮に入れなければならない。
english: In judging his work, we must take account of his lack of experience.

japanese: 彼の作品は誉める言葉がない。
english: His work is beyond all praise.

japanese: 彼の作品は水準に達していない。
english: His work is not up to standard.

japanese: 彼の作品は時の試練に耐えて後世に残るだろう。
english: His works will stand the test of time.

japanese: 彼の作品は期待はずれでした。
english: His work hasn't come up to my expectations.

japanese: 彼の作品は何世紀間も残るだろう。
english: His works will endure for centuries.

japanese: 彼の作品はたとえようもないほど素晴らしい。
english: His work is beyond comparison.

japanese: 彼の作品はいくつかのアイデアの統合体である。
english: His work is a synthesis of several ideas.

japanese: 彼の作品の中でこれが最高だ。
english: This is the best among his works.

japanese: 彼の財政状態は悪いほうへ変わった。
english: His finances have changed for the worse.

japanese: 彼の財政状態はよいほうへ変わった。
english: His finances have changed for the better.

japanese: 彼の財産は１億ドルと概算された。
english: His property was estimated at one hundred million dollars.

japanese: 彼の財産でなく、彼の人柄のために私は彼が好きだ。
english: I love him for what he is, not what he has.

japanese: 彼の財産がただで私に転がり込んだ。
english: His estate came to me as a free gift.

japanese: 彼の罪を大目に見て許してあげたほうがいいのではないか。
english: You may as well overlook his sins and forgive him.

japanese: 彼の罪を許してあげた方がいいんじゃない。
english: You may as well forgive his sins.

japanese: 彼の罪は露見するだろう。
english: His sin will find him out.

japanese: 彼の罪は死刑に値する。
english: His crime deserves the death penalty.

japanese: 彼の裁判で真実がついに明らかになった。
english: The truth finally came out at his trial.

japanese: 彼の才能は大変素晴らしくそして多様であった。
english: His abilities were very great and various.

japanese: 彼の才能に敬服しています。
english: I feel admiration for his talent.

japanese: 彼の才能はその仕事にうってつけだ。
english: His skill qualifies him for the job.

japanese: 彼の才能にはおそれいったよ。
english: I admire his talent.

japanese: 彼の才能にもかかわらず、彼はあいかわらず、無名だ。
english: For all his genius, he is as unknown as ever.

japanese: 彼の妻も彼もそれを好む。
english: Both his wife and he like it.

japanese: 彼の妻は必要から働き出した。
english: His wife has started to work out of necessity.

japanese: 彼の妻は彼を記者達に会わせなかった。
english: His wife screened him from reporters.

japanese: 彼の妻は彼のためにドアを開けた。
english: His wife opened the door for him.

japanese: 彼の妻は彼に危険を冒さないでね、と懇願した。
english: His wife begged him not to run any risk.

japanese: 彼の妻は彼に一日中がみがみ言っている。
english: His wife nags him constantly.

japanese: 彼の妻は二人の愛の結晶を残して死んだ。
english: His wife died leaving behind their two beloved children.

japanese: 彼の妻は双子の男の子を産んだ。
english: His wife gave birth to twin boys.

japanese: 彼の妻は自動車事故でけがをしたので入院している。
english: His wife is in the hospital because she was injured in a car crash.

japanese: 彼の妻は私の友達のひとりだ。
english: His wife is one of my friends.

japanese: 彼の妻は私には醜いとは思えない。
english: His wife doesn't seem ugly to me.

japanese: 彼の妻は子供たちの世話をした後で疲れ切っている。
english: His wife is worn out after looking after the children.

japanese: 彼の妻は客を招きたかった。
english: His wife liked inviting guests.

japanese: 彼の妻は今や彼らの２人の子供は言うまでもなく、彼の祖父も面倒を見なければならなかった。
english: His wife now had to take care of his grandfather, not to mention their two children.

japanese: 彼の妻はもちろん子供たちもそのパーティーに招待された。
english: His children as well as his wife were invited to the party.

japanese: 彼の妻はその事故で死亡した。
english: His wife was killed in the accident.

japanese: 彼の妻はさまざまな心配事に打ちひしがれていた。
english: His wife was weighed down with various worries.

japanese: 彼の妻はカリフォルニアの出身だ。
english: His wife comes from California.

japanese: 彼の妻は２人の娘と１人の息子を産んだ。
english: His wife bore him two daughters and a son.

japanese: 彼の妻は、彼が怒った時、彼の扱いを知っている。
english: His wife knows how to manage him when he gets angry.

japanese: 彼の妻の姿はどこにも見えなかった。
english: His wife was nowhere in evidence.

japanese: 彼の妻だけでなく子供たちもそのパーティーに招待された。
english: His children as well as his wife were invited to the party.

japanese: 彼の妻がピアノで彼の伴奏をした。
english: His wife accompanied him on the piano.

japanese: 彼の最大の欠点はしゃべりすぎることだ。
english: His greatest fault is talking too much.

japanese: 彼の最新作は大ヒットした。
english: His latest work proved to be a great success.

japanese: 彼の最新作は趣を異にする。
english: His latest work belongs to a different category.

japanese: 彼の最新作の小説はおもしろいと思った。
english: I found his latest novel interesting.

japanese: 彼の最新作が一時的に展示されている。
english: His latest works are on temporary display.

japanese: 彼の最新の作品が市庁舎で展示されているの。言葉に出来ないほど素敵よ。
english: His latest works are on display at the city hall. They are fabulous beyond description.

japanese: 彼の最新の作品がその広場に展示されている。
english: His latest works are on display at the square.

japanese: 彼の最後の言葉は全員を失望させた。
english: His last word let everybody down.

japanese: 彼の最後の手段は父の所へ行って助けを求めることである。
english: His last recourse will be to go to his father for help.

japanese: 彼の最近作は前作に比べて進歩がある。
english: His latest work is an advance on his previous one.

japanese: 彼の最近作の小説は以前のに比べて長足の進歩を示している。
english: His latest novel marks a great advance on his previous ones.

japanese: 彼の最近の小説は読む価値が充分ある。
english: His latest novel is well worth reading.

japanese: 彼の座右の銘は「暮らしは質素に、理想は高く」だ。
english: His motto is "Plain living and high thinking."

japanese: 彼の左目に髪がたれていた。
english: A wisp of hair fell over his left eye.

japanese: 彼の左側には彼の母親が座っていた。
english: On his left sat his mother.

japanese: 彼の魂は天国にいた。
english: His soul was in heaven.

japanese: 彼の魂に平和を！
english: Peace to his ashes!

japanese: 彼の困ったところはめったに時間を守らないことです。
english: The trouble with him is that he is seldom punctual.

japanese: 彼の今日のテストの点は昨日取った点の二倍だ。
english: His score on the test today is twice what he got yesterday.

japanese: 彼の今日あるのは勉強のおかげである。
english: Hard work has made him what he is.

japanese: 彼の今日あるのはあなたのおかげです。
english: You have made him what he is.

japanese: 彼の今度の小説は自分自身の体験に基づいている。
english: His new novel is based on his own experiences.

japanese: 彼の今度の小説は自分の体験に基づいていると言われている。
english: It is said that his new novel is based on his own experiences.

japanese: 彼の今度の小説はすごく退屈だった。たいした作家ではないと思う。
english: I found his new novel very dull. I don't think he is much of a writer.

japanese: 彼の今度の小説はいかがでしたか。
english: How do you find his new novel?

japanese: 彼の今回の判断、理解に苦しむね。焼きが回ったということかね。

japanese: 彼の骨折りでこの会はできた。

japanese: 彼の言っていることに注目した。
english: I took note of what he was saying.

japanese: 彼の言っていることが嘘だとわかった。
english: What he had said turned out to be a lie.

japanese: 彼の言っていることがぜんぶ理解できるの？
english: Are you taking in all he is saying?

japanese: 彼の言った通りになった。
english: His words have come true.

japanese: 彼の言った事は無視しなさい。冗談を言っていただけなのだから。
english: Take no account of what he said, he was only joking.

japanese: 彼の言った事は決して本当ではない。
english: What he said is by no means true.

japanese: 彼の言った事は何の意味もない。
english: What he said counts for nothing.

japanese: 彼の言った事はたぶん本当だろう。
english: What he said may well be true.

japanese: 彼の言った事はさっぱり分からなかった。
english: I could make nothing of what he said.

japanese: 彼の言った事はこの場合にも当てはまる。
english: What he said also applies in this case.

japanese: 彼の言った事は、ひどく私を傷つけた。
english: His statement really cut me.

japanese: 彼の言った事に意味はない。
english: What he said counts for nothing.

japanese: 彼の言った言葉はこの場合あてはまらない。
english: The words he said don't apply in this situation.

japanese: 彼の言ったことは要するにこういうことだ。
english: What he said boils down to this.

japanese: 彼の言ったことを覚えておきなさい。
english: Bear in mind what he said.

japanese: 彼の言ったことは本当ではなかった。
english: What he said was not true.

japanese: 彼の言ったことは本当であるとわかりました。
english: What he said proved true.

japanese: 彼の言ったことは本当かもしれない。
english: What he said may well be true.

japanese: 彼の言ったことは分からなかった。
english: I couldn't catch what he said.

japanese: 彼の言ったことは的はずれだった。
english: What he said was beside the point.

japanese: 彼の言ったことは大体正しい。
english: Mainly, what he said is right.

japanese: 彼の言ったことは全部本当でした。
english: All he said was true.

japanese: 彼の言ったことは全て正しかった。
english: All what he said was right.

japanese: 彼の言ったことは全く真実ではなかった。
english: What he said was far from true.

japanese: 彼の言ったことは真実だ。
english: What he said is true.

japanese: 彼が何を言っているのか分からない。
english: What he said doesn't make sense to me.

japanese: 彼の言ったことは誤解を招いた。
english: What he said has brought about a misunderstanding.

japanese: 彼の言ったことは脅しにほかならなかった。
english: What he said was nothing less than a threat.

japanese: 彼の言ったことは何の重要性もない。
english: What he said is of no importance.

japanese: 彼の言ったことはまさか本当であるとは思えない。
english: What he said can scarcely be true.

japanese: 彼の言ったことははっきり分からなかった。
english: I didn't quite make out what he said.

japanese: 彼の言ったことはその問題に関係ない。
english: What he said is irrelevant to the matter.

japanese: 彼の言ったことはある意味本当だ。
english: What he said is, in a way, true.

japanese: 彼の言ったことはある意味真実である。
english: What he said is true in a sense.

japanese: 彼の言ったことは、ある程度、この場合に当てはまる。
english: What he said applies, to a certain extent, to this case.

japanese: 彼が言ったことの真意が徐々にわかり始めた。
english: Gradually the true meaning of what he said began to dawn on me.

japanese: 彼の言ったことの意味が全然分からなかったよ。
english: I did not understand him at all.

japanese: 彼の言ったことに大部分賛成です。
english: For the most part, I agree with what he said.

japanese: 彼の言ったことにはあまり内容がなかった。
english: There wasn't much in what he said.

japanese: 彼の言ったことなど問題にしなかった。
english: I took no account of what he said.

japanese: 彼の言ったことが少しも理解できなかった。
english: I didn't understand in the least what he said.

japanese: 彼の言おうとしていることは全くわかりやすい。
english: His meaning is quite plain.

japanese: 彼の言う事を真に受けるなんて僕は馬鹿だった。
english: I should have known better than to believe him.

japanese: 彼の言う事を信用したらだめよ。
english: You cannot believe a word he says.

japanese: 彼の言う事を信じますか。
english: Do you believe him?

japanese: 彼の言う事を書き留めてください。
english: Please write down his words.

japanese: 彼の言う事には誠意が欠けている。
english: His statement lacks sincerity.

japanese: 彼の言う言葉を信じてはいけません。
english: You can not believe a word he says.

japanese: 彼の言うようにしなさい。
english: Do it like he tells you.

japanese: 彼の言うとおりにしなさい。
english: Do as he tells you.

japanese: 彼の言うような話は一度も聞いた事がない。
english: I've never heard the kind of stories he tells.

japanese: 彼の言うとおりだと思う。
english: I think that he is right.

japanese: 彼の言うことを注意して聞きなさい。
english: Pay attention to what he says.

japanese: 彼の言うことを信頼できないのは、風を頼りにできないのと同じだ。
english: You can not depend on his word any more than on the wind.

japanese: 彼の言うことを信ずる十分な根拠がある。
english: There are good grounds for believing what he says.

japanese: 彼の言うことを信じるほどばかな人はいない。
english: No one is so foolish as to believe what he says.

japanese: 彼の言うことを信じるなんて君は馬鹿だ。
english: It's silly of you to believe him.

japanese: 彼の言うことを信じるなんて、私はなんてばかなんだろう。
english: How foolish I am to believe him!

japanese: 彼の言うことは本当です。
english: What he says is true.

japanese: 彼の言うことを信じないではいられない。
english: I cannot help believing what he says.

japanese: 彼の言うことは僕には一向にわからない。
english: I can make nothing of what he says.

japanese: 彼の言うことは非常に重要である。
english: What he says is very important.

japanese: 彼の言うことは認めるが、彼に賛成することは出来ない。
english: Admitting what he says, I still cannot agree with him.

japanese: 彼の言うことは当てにならないよ。
english: You must not rely on his word.

japanese: 彼の言うことは全然わからない。
english: I cannot make anything of what he says.

japanese: 彼の言うことは全く正しい。
english: He is quite right.

japanese: 彼の言うことは絶対正しい。
english: What he says is gospel.

japanese: 彼の言うことは私には何のことかさっぱりわからない。
english: His words convey nothing at all to me.

japanese: 彼の言うことは私にとってまったく重要ではない。
english: What he says is of no importance to me.

japanese: 彼の言うことは見当違いのようです。
english: His remark seems to be off the point.

japanese: 彼の言うことは何でも正しい。
english: Whatever he says is right.

japanese: 彼の言うことは一言も聞くに値しない。
english: Not a word he says is worthy to be heard.

japanese: 彼の言うことは意味を成さない。
english: What he says does not make any sense.

japanese: 彼の言うことはとても信じがたかった。
english: I could hardly believe him.

japanese: 彼の言うことはくさい。
english: I doubt the truth of his statement.

japanese: 彼の言うことはいちいち頭に来る。
english: Everything he says upsets me.

japanese: 彼の言うことはある意味正しい。
english: What he says is true in a sense.

japanese: 彼の言うことは本当ではないと思う。
english: I don't think he is truthful.

japanese: 彼の言うことはあながち間違っていない。
english: He is not altogether wrong.

japanese: 彼の言うことに注意を払うべきだ。
english: You should pay attention to what he says.

japanese: 彼の言うことに注意を注いだ。
english: I concentrated on what he was saying.

japanese: 彼の言うことに耳を傾けた。
english: I inclined my ear to him.

japanese: 彼の言うことには理論の飛躍がありすぎる。
english: There is a leap of logic in what he says.

japanese: 彼の言うことには本当のことは全然ない。
english: There isn't a grain of truth in what he says.

japanese: 彼の言うことには半信半疑だ。
english: I don't quite believe what he says.

japanese: 彼の言うことには真実があるだろうという可能性はない。
english: There is no possibility that what he says may have any truth in it.

japanese: 彼の言うことには疑いは全くない。
english: There is no doubt whatever about what he says.

japanese: 彼の言うことなんて信用したらだめだよ。
english: You can not believe a word he says.

japanese: 彼の言うことなど気にする必要はない。
english: You don't have to pay attention to what he says.

japanese: 彼の言うことって、いちいちカチンとくるんだよね。
english: I find his every word truly offensive.

japanese: 彼の言うことすべてを書き取ろうとした。
english: I tried to get down every word he said.

japanese: 彼の言うことすべてが、私の神経を逆なでするのです。
english: Everything he says rubs me the wrong way.

japanese: 彼の言うことがわかったか。
english: Did you make out what he said?

japanese: 彼の言うことがよくわからない。
english: I don't quite understand what he says.

japanese: 彼の言いなりになるくらいなら、独りで暮らした方がましだ。
english: I would rather live by myself than do as he tells me to do.

japanese: 彼の言いつけに従うより他に仕方がなかった。
english: There was nothing for it but to obey him.

japanese: 彼の現実離れした提案はみんなを驚かせた。
english: His impractical proposal astonished us all.

japanese: 彼の賢さは大したものです。
english: He is remarkable for his wisdom.

japanese: 彼の現在の助手は野上さんです。
english: His present assistant is Miss Nokami.

japanese: 彼の謙遜さは賞賛に値する。
english: His modesty is worth respecting.

japanese: 彼の見方はあまりに保守的で人々は受け入れなかった。
english: His views were too conservative for people to accept.

japanese: 彼の肩ばかり持つなよ。
english: Don't always take sides with him.

japanese: 彼の肩には責任が重くのしかかっている。
english: A great responsibility lies on his shoulders.

japanese: 彼の研究室には、1000冊以上のノートが保存されていた。
english: Preserved in his laboratory were more than a thousand notebooks.

japanese: 彼の研究は広範囲に及んでいる。
english: His studies cover a wide field.

japanese: 彼の研究は広範囲にわたっている。
english: His study covers a wide area.

japanese: 彼の研究はついに実を結んだ。
english: His research bore fruit in the end.

japanese: 彼の研究はその種の最高のものに匹敵する。
english: His research ranks among the best of its kind.

japanese: 彼の研究はいわゆる事実に基づいている。
english: His study is based on what is called fact.

japanese: 彼の犬は彼のよい友達です。
english: His dog is his good companion.

japanese: 彼の研究で用いられた方法論は、我々の調査を行う際にも役に立つ。
english: The methodology used in his study is also helpful to us in conducting our research.

japanese: 彼の犬は彼にポパイと名付けられた。
english: His dog was named Popeye by him.

japanese: 彼の犬は庭の中を走っていた。
english: His dog was running in the yard.

japanese: 彼の犬は耳が遠い。
english: His dog is hard of hearing.

japanese: 彼の犬は私を見ると吠える。
english: His dog barks at me.

japanese: 彼の犬は、彼の行くところへはどこへでもついていく。
english: His dog follows him wherever he goes.

japanese: 彼は犬の絵を書いた。
english: He painted a picture of a dog.

japanese: 彼の犬がドアの後ろから現れた。
english: His dog appeared from behind the door.

japanese: 彼の権力欲には際限がない。
english: His greed for power knows no bounds.

japanese: 彼の懸命の努力は失敗に終わった。
english: His persistent efforts resulted in failure.

japanese: 彼の懸命の努力が実を結んだ。
english: His hard work bore fruit.

japanese: 彼の健康状態はよくない。
english: He is in a poor state of health.

japanese: 彼の健康は徐々に回復している。
english: His health is improving little by little.

japanese: 彼の健康は快方に向かいつつある。
english: His health is changing for the better.

japanese: 彼の健康は回復してきている。
english: He is improving in health.

japanese: 彼の健康はもう衰え始めた。
english: His health has begun to decline.

japanese: 彼の健康が気がかりです。
english: I am anxious about his health.

japanese: 彼の健康が心配だ。
english: I am concerned about his health.

japanese: 彼の月収では家族を養えない。
english: He cannot support his family on his monthly income.

japanese: 彼の月収は５０万円である。
english: His monthly income amounts to half a million yen.

japanese: 彼の結論は完全な間違いであることが明らかになった。
english: His solution turned out to be a complete mistake.

japanese: 彼の結論はこれらの事実に基づいている。
english: His conclusion is based on these facts.

japanese: 彼の結婚生活を見て幻滅を感じた。
english: I was disillusioned at his married life.

japanese: この汚い服は彼の潔白を証明する新しい証拠かもしれません。
english: These dirty clothes could be a new piece of evidence to prove his innocence.

japanese: 彼の決定は重大な誤りであると彼女は考えた。
english: She looked on his decision as a grave mistake.

japanese: 彼の決心は確固たるものだった。
english: He was quite decided in his determination.

japanese: 彼の決断力のおかげで、彼はその危機を乗り切ることが出来た。
english: Because of his determination, he was able to tide over the crisis.

japanese: 彼の欠点のゆえにかえって人々は彼を好いた。
english: People liked him all the better for his faults.

japanese: 彼の欠点にもかかわらず私は彼を愛する。
english: I love him none the less for his faults.

japanese: 彼の欠点にもかかわらずサムはとても好ましい人物だ。
english: For all his faults, Sam is still a very likable person.

japanese: 彼の欠席はいろいろな噂の原因となった。
english: His absence gave birth to all sorts of rumors.

japanese: 彼の欠席で事が面倒になる。
english: His being absent complicates matters.

japanese: 彼の傑作はまだ現れていない。
english: His masterpiece has not appeared yet.

japanese: 彼の芸はこなれていない。
english: His talent is green.

japanese: 彼の警告に注意しなかった。
english: No attention was paid to his warning.

japanese: 彼の警告に全然注意が払われなかった。
english: No attention was paid to his warning.

japanese: 彼の警告に少しも注意が払われなかった。
english: No attention was paid to his warning.

japanese: 彼の計画は僕はまったく知らない。
english: I am quite ignorant of his plan.

japanese: 彼の計画は難しすぎるように思われたが、間もなくそれは実現できることがわかった。
english: His plan seemed to be too difficult, but before long it proved to be feasible.

japanese: 彼の計画は中止されるべきでない。
english: His plan ought not to be abandoned.

japanese: 彼の計画は退けられた。
english: His plan was discarded.

japanese: 彼の計画は実行不可能のように思われる。
english: His plan sounds impracticable.

japanese: 彼の計画は実行不可能だと彼らには思われた。
english: His plan struck them as impractical.

japanese: 彼の計画は失敗に終わった。
english: His project ended in failure.

japanese: 彼の計画は資金不足のため失敗した。
english: His undertaking failed for lack of funds.

japanese: 彼の計画は結局はうまくいかなかった。
english: His scheme went wrong in the end.

japanese: 彼の計画はヤバイぞ。
english: I see a great danger in his plan.

japanese: 彼の計画はまだ未定だ。
english: His plan is still in the air.

japanese: 彼の計画はまだ不完全な点が多い。
english: His plan leaves much to be desired.

japanese: 彼の計画はどうにもならない。
english: Nothing will come of his plans.

japanese: 彼の計画はうまくいかないだろう。
english: He will get nowhere with his plans.

japanese: 彼の計画は、月曜日に出発することだった。
english: His plan was to start on Monday.

japanese: 彼の計画は、その川に橋を架けることです。
english: His plan is to build a bridge over that river.

japanese: 彼の計画に同意するよりほかに仕方がない。
english: There is no choice but to agree to his plan.

japanese: 彼の計画に賛成します。
english: I agree to his plan.

japanese: 彼の計画に賛成です。
english: I agree with his plan.

japanese: 彼の計画には長所も欠点もある。
english: His plan has both virtues and liabilities.

japanese: 彼の計画には金が多くかかる。
english: His plan will call for a lot of money.

japanese: 彼の計画が実行に移された。
english: His plan was put into action.

japanese: 彼の経歴を会社に問い合わせた。
english: I referred to the company for his work record.

japanese: 彼の経歴は前任者のそれに匹敵する。
english: His background parallels that of his predecessor.

japanese: 彼の経験不足を認めるにしても、私はやはり彼はもっとよくやるべきだと思う。
english: Admitting his lack of experience, I still think that he ought to do better.

japanese: 彼の経験不足は大目にみなくてはならない。
english: You must make allowance for his inexperience.

japanese: 彼の経験があればその仕事をするのに十分だ。
english: His experience qualifies him to do the job.

japanese: 彼の経営手腕を疑問視する役員もいた。
english: Some board members questioned his ability to run the corporation.

japanese: 彼の携帯電話は他の電話を妨害する電波を出した。
english: His mobile phone produced radio emissions that interfered with other phones.

japanese: 彼の契約はもう１年間有効だ。
english: His contract runs for one more year.

japanese: 彼の兄弟は二人とも、先生です。
english: Both his brothers are teachers.

japanese: 彼の兄弟は２人とも知らない。
english: I know neither of his brothers.

japanese: 彼の兄弟のどちらも知らない。
english: I don't know either of his brothers.

japanese: 彼の兄は貿易会社に勤めています。
english: His brother works for a trading company.

japanese: 彼の兄は先月亡くなった。
english: His brother passed away last month.

japanese: 彼の兄は私より２つ年上です。
english: His older brother is two years older than I.

japanese: 彼の兄は私に意地が悪かった。
english: His brother was nasty to me.

japanese: 彼の兄はバスで学校に行きます。
english: His brother goes to school by bus.

japanese: 彼の兄はとても有能な医者だ。
english: His brother is a very capable doctor.

japanese: 彼の兄はとても優秀な医者だ。
english: His brother is a very capable doctor.

japanese: 彼の兄はその活動に命を捧げた。
english: His brother dedicated his life to the activity.

japanese: 彼の兄はコンピューターのことしか頭にない。
english: His brother has nothing but computers on his mind.

japanese: 彼の兄の方はいっそう背が高い。
english: His brother is still taller.

japanese: 彼のお兄さんは有名なサッカーの選手です。
english: His brother is a famous soccer player.

japanese: 彼の兄さんは彼よりも我慢強い。
english: His brother is more patient than he is.

japanese: 彼の兄さんはまもなく帰宅した。
english: His brother came home soon after.

japanese: 彼の兄さんはバスで学校へ行きます。
english: His brother goes to school by bus.

japanese: 彼の靴下には穴があいている。
english: There is a hole in his sock.

japanese: 彼の靴は茶色だ。
english: His shoes are brown.

japanese: 彼の靴は擦り減った。
english: His shoes are wearing thin.

japanese: 彼の靴はとても古かったので足の指が靴からはみ出ていた。
english: His shoes were so old that his toes were sticking out of them.

japanese: 彼の靴はとても古いので足の先が出ていた。
english: His shoes were so old that his toes were sticking out of them.

japanese: 彼の靴に泥がぴったりくっついていた。
english: The mud clung to his shoes.

japanese: 彼の勤め先はどこですか。
english: Who does he work for?

japanese: 彼の近くにいる背の高い婦人の方を振り向きました。
english: He turned to a tall woman nearby.

japanese: 彼の業績は最高の賞賛に値する。
english: His work merits the highest praise.
